title: Year 10 Mathematics
subtitle: AOS 7 Revision - Mixed Mock CAT 2
instructions: Answer ALL questions in the spaces provided
Show all working to receive full marks
CAS calculators are permitted unless otherwise stated
Diagrams are NOT drawn to scale
Give answers correct to 2 decimal places unless otherwise specified
Exact values should be given where indicated

questions.text: Two triangles ABC and DEF are shown. Determine whether they are congruent. If so, state the congruence condition (SSS, SAS, AAS, or RHS) and write the congruence statement.
Triangle PQR is similar to triangle XYZ with a scale factor of 2.5. If PQ = 6 cm, QR = 8 cm, and PR = 10 cm, find:

parts.label: a
parts.text: The length of XY.

parts.label: b
parts.text: The length of YZ.

parts.label: c
parts.text: If the area of triangle PQR is 24 cm², find the area of triangle XYZ.

questions.text: A circular swimming pool has a radius of 10 metres. Two lane ropes are stretched across the pool as straight chords. Lane rope AB is 6 metres from the centre, and lane rope CD is 8 metres from the centre.

parts.label: a
parts.text: Find the length of lane rope AB.

parts.label: b
parts.text: Find the length of lane rope CD.

questions.text: A circular stadium has seating around its perimeter. Points A, B, C, and D represent four spectator positions on the stadium boundary, with the centre of the field at O. The angle AOB at the centre (covering the main stage) is 124°, and spectator at position C sees the angle BCD = 98°.

parts.label: a
parts.text: Find angle ADB (the viewing angle of the stage from seat D), giving a reason for your answer.

parts.label: b
parts.text: Find angle DAB, giving a reason for your answer.

questions.text: A circular pond in a park has a straight footpath that touches the pond at point T (tangent). A jogger at point P on the footpath can see across the pond to point Q on the opposite edge. The distance from P to T along the footpath is 12 m, and the distance from P to Q is 8 m. Find the length of the chord TQ (the pond's edge visible between T and Q).
In the diagram, AC is a tangent to the circle at B. Points B, D, and E lie on the circle. Angle DBE = 54° and angle ABD = 3x + 12°. Find the value of x, giving reasons.

A rescue helicopter hovers at a height where its rescue rope, when fully extended at an angle of 42° to the vertical, reaches exactly 18 metres in length. Calculate the horizontal distance from the helicopter to the rescue point on the ground, correct to two decimal places.
Find the value of θ in the triangle shown, correct to one decimal place.

From the top of a building 65 m tall, the angle of depression to a car parked on the street is 28°. Calculate the horizontal distance from the base of the building to the car, correct to one decimal place.
A yacht sails from port A on a bearing of 065° for 24 km to point B. It then sails on a bearing of 155° for 18 km to point C.

parts.label: a
parts.text: Draw a diagram showing the yacht's journey.

parts.label: b
parts.text: Find angle ABC.

parts.label: c
parts.text: Use the cosine rule to find the direct distance from A to C.

questions.text: A surveyor is measuring a triangular paddock ABC. From corner A, the angle to the other corners is 42°. From corner B, the angle is 73°. The fence along side BC (opposite to corner A) measures 15 metres.

parts.label: a
parts.text: Find the length of fence AB (opposite to corner C), correct to 2 decimal places.

parts.label: b
parts.text: Calculate the area of the paddock, correct to 2 decimal places.

questions.text: Without using a calculator, find the exact values of:

parts.label: a
parts.text: sin 120°

parts.label: b
parts.text: cos 315°

parts.label: c
parts.text: tan 210°

parts.label: a
parts.text: Convert 225° to radians, giving your answer in terms of π.

parts.label: b
parts.text: Convert 5π/4 radians to degrees.

parts.label: c
parts.text: Find the exact value of sin(5π/6) + cos(2π/3).

questions.text: The height of a passenger on a Ferris wheel can be modeled by a sine function. The graph shows the height variation as the wheel rotates through 360°.

parts.label: a
parts.text: Use the graph to estimate the height (sin value) when the wheel has rotated 130°.

parts.label: b
parts.text: Find the rotation angles between 0° and 360° when sin θ = -0.5.

questions.text: Calculate the surface area of the composite shape shown, which consists of a rectangle with three semicircles. Give your answer correct to one decimal place.
A farmer needs to paint the exterior of a cylindrical grain silo. The silo has a radius of 5 metres and a height of 12 metres.

parts.label: a
parts.text: Calculate the area of the curved surface to be painted.

parts.label: b
parts.text: If the farmer also paints the flat circular roof, calculate the total area to be painted.

questions.text: A shopping centre has a square-based pyramid-shaped glass skylight. The base of the skylight is 8 metres × 8 metres, and the slant height of each glass panel is 10 metres.

parts.label: a
parts.text: Find the perpendicular height of the skylight from base to apex.

parts.label: b
parts.text: Calculate the total area of glass required (4 triangular panels only, not the base).

questions.text: A steel block measuring 10 cm × 8 cm × 6 cm has a cylindrical hole of diameter 4 cm drilled completely through it (through the 6 cm height). Calculate the volume of the remaining steel, correct to two decimal places.

Type 5: Construct & Calculate

A storage container consists of a cylindrical body with a conical top. The cylinder has a diameter of 4 m and the total height of the container is 9 m. The slant height of the cone is 2.5 m.

parts.label: a
parts.text: Draw a labeled diagram of the container showing all given dimensions.

parts.label: b
parts.text: Calculate the perpendicular height of the cone.

parts.label: c
parts.text: Find the height of the cylindrical part.

parts.label: d
parts.text: Calculate the total volume of the container, correct to two decimal places.
